ARABIC: وَيَوْمَ نُسَيِّرُ ٱلْجِبَالَ وَتَرَى ٱلْأَرْضَ بَارِزَةً وَحَشَرْنَٰهُمْ فَلَمْ نُغَادِرْ مِنْهُمْ أَحَدًا

ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_0: On the Day We make the mountains move and you see the earth laid bare and We gather them together, not leaving out a single one of them,
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_1: The day We shall move the mountains, and you see the earth an open plain, We shall gather them together, leaving none behind.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_2: Bear in mind the Day when We shall set the mountains in motion and you will find the earth void and bare. On that Day We shall muster all men together, leaving none of them behind.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_3: On the day when We will cause the mountains to travel around and the earth to turn into a levelled plain, We will also bring all human beings together. No one will be left behind.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_4: And the Day when We move the hills and you see the earth flattened plain, and We shall raise all of them together – so not leaving out any one of them.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_5: And (remember) the Day We shall cause the mountains to pass away, and you will see the earth as a levelled plain, and We shall gather them so that We will leave not one of them behind.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_6: And the day on which We will cause the mountains to pass away and you will see the earth a levelled plain and We will gather them and leave not any one of them behind.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_7: And on the day We shall set the mountains in motion, and thou seest the earth coming forth, and We muster them so that We leave not so much as one of them behind;
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_8: And (bethink you of) the Day when we remove the hills and ye see the earth emerging, and We gather them together so as to leave not one of them behind.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_9: The Day We shall make the mountains move and you will see the earth laid bare, and We shall gather all mankind together and shall not leave any one of them behind.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_10: And beware a Day whereon we will make the mountains to pass, and thou wilt see the earth away plain, and We shall gather them, and We shall leave of them not one.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_11: The day We shall set the mountains moving and you will see the earth in full view, We shall muster them, and We will not leave out anyone of them.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_12: One Day We shall remove the mountains, and thou wilt see the earth as a level stretch, and We shall gather them, all together, nor shall We leave out any one of them.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_13: And (remember) the Day We shall cause the mountains to pass away (like clouds of dust), and you will see the earth as a levelled plain, and we shall gather them all together so as to leave not one of them behind.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_14: And on the Day when We shall set the mountains in motion and you shall see the earth a leveled plain; when We gather them together, and would not leave even one behind,
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_15: On the Day when We set the mountains in motion; and you see the earth emerging; and We gather them together, and leave none of them behind.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_16: And [warn of] the Day when We will remove the mountains and you will see the earth prominent, and We will gather them and not leave behind from them anyone.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_17: [18:47] And, mention, the day when the mountains shall be set in motion — they shall be removed from the face of the earth and become ‘[as] scattered dust’ [Q. 56:6] (a variant reading [for tusayyaru’l-jibālu] has nusayyiru’l-jibāla, ‘We shall set the mountains in motion’) and you will see the earth exposed, manifest [in full view], with no mountain or anything else on top of it. And We shall gather them, believers and disbelievers, such that We will not leave out anyone of them.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_18: (And (bethink you of) the Day when We remove the hills) from the face of the earth (and ye see the earth emerging) from beneath mountains, (and We gather them) for the Resurrection (together so as to leave not one of them behind).
